model

Class FiringRulesState

  • java.lang.Object
    • model.FiringRulesState
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    CycleState

     class FiringRulesState
extends Object
implements CycleState
    This class implements the CycleState interface. It fires the reactive rules and get the new goals to solve.
    Author:
    Alexandre Camus
    See Also:
    CycleState, ReactiveRuleSet

    • Method Detail

      • handlerMethod

        public void handlerMethod(CycleHandler STATE_CONTEXT,
                 String NAME,
                 RuleSet events)
        This is the implementation of the CycleState#handlerMethod(). Here it fires the reactive rules and gets the new goals to solve.
        Specified by:
        handlerMethod in interface CycleState
        Parameters:
        STATE_CONTEXT - the manager of the state which is here the only instance of CycleHandler.
        NAME - the name of the step. It has no use except to debug.
        events - an object RuleSet that contains the events/actions that will be or have been performed during the very cycle.
        See Also:
        CycleState.handlerMethod(CycleHandler, String, RuleSet)

      • fireRules

        private void fireRules(RuleSet events)
        This is the private action of the state. It cannot be used except in the context of the handlerMethod(). Here this fires the reactive rules and gets the new goals to solve.
        Parameters:
        events -
        See Also:
        ReactiveRuleSet.fireRules(RuleSet, List), handlerMethod(CycleHandler, String, RuleSet)
